definition: hard to deal with/hard to get along with
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of

sentences.english: This stwoulmplifier is hard to come by.
Circle back to the frustrating task later and you might just see the solution from a different vantage point.
sentences.chinese: 以後再處理難搞的任務，或許就能柳暗花明。

sentences.english: They're really hard to get. I purchased them years ago in great volume.
sentences.chinese: 這些琴絃很難搞到手，幾年前我買了一大批儲備起來。

sentences.english: Rectangular color schemes are not only the most complex, but the hardest to work with.
sentences.chinese: 矩形選色法不僅是最複雜的，而且是最難搞懂的。

sentences.english: Realize that the harder you work, the luckier you will become.
sentences.chinese: 要記住，你的工作越難搞，你將越走運。

sentences.english: You n't make bricks without straw .
Comedy is hard, so keep your fingers crossed.
sentences.chinese: 喜劇是難搞的，只能祝其好運啦。

to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
heartless/without regard for others' feelings
fickle in love/sentimentality

to take care of one's family

hard to understand/incomprehensible
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
virgin/maiden/inaugural
